data.title: How to Get to Rawang by Train?
data.meta_description: For those traveling from KL Sentral to Rawang, the journey is served by the Northbound Train line and there are Gold and Silver class trains available. The
data.text:
Rawang: General Information about Destination

Rawang is a town located in Selangor, Malaysia, about 20 kilometers from Kuala Lumpur. Known for its proximity to industrial areas, Rawang is home to many factories and industrial parks, making it a hub for manufacturing and logistics.

Despite being an industrial center, Rawang also offers several attractions for visitors, such as the Templer Park Rainforest Reserve, which offers hiking trails and a refreshing waterfall. Another popular destination is the Kanching Rainforest Waterfall, which is located nearby and is known for its seven tiers of cascading waterfalls.

For shopping enthusiasts, there is the AEON Rawang Shopping Centre, which offers a variety of shops, restaurants, and entertainment options.

Information about the Route (KL Sentral – Rawang)

Rawang is a popular destination for many locals due to the high concentration of businesses in the area. If you’re looking to travel to Rawang from Kuala Lumpur by train, you have two options to choose from: the ETS train and the KTM Komuter train.

See also: How to Get from Shah Alam to Rawang by Train

KL Sentral to Rawang by ETS Train

For those traveling from KL Sentral to Rawang, the journey is served by the Northbound Train line and there are Gold and Silver class trains available. The shortest travel time for both Silver and Gold class trains is 45 minutes.

The cost of a ticket for the Silver class starts at RM11.00, and for the Gold class, the starting price is RM13.00. Tickets can be purchased online or at the ticket counter at the station.

Schedule

(Jadual ETS KL Sentral ke Rawang)

Trains from KL Sentral to Rawang run six times a day. The first train leaves at 08:47 in the morning, and the last train departs at 21:40 in the evening.

KL Sentral to Rawang by KTM Komuter

Travelers taking the train from KL Sentral to Rawang will use the Pelabuhan Klang – Tanjung Malim rail line. This journey includes stops at 10 stations between the departure and arrival points. The shortest duration for the trip is 60 minutes, which is the same on both weekdays and weekends.

Tickets for this route can be bought at the stations, and it’s important to note that advance ticket purchases are not available for the KTM Komuter service.

Schedule

(Jadual KTM Komuter KL Sentral ke Rawang)

On weekdays, trains from KL Sentral to Rawang run seven times a day. The earliest train departs at 06:57 in the morning, and the last train leaves at 20:25 in the evening.

On weekends, the service runs six times a day, with the first train leaving at 08:23 in the morning and the last departure at 20:25 in the evening.

See also: ETS Train from Rawang to Ipoh

Departure Point – KL Sentral and Kuala Lumpur Station

KL Sentral

KL Sentral Station, located in the southwest of Kuala Lumpur City, is a modern transportation hub that connects major modes of transportation, making it the main departure point for those traveling from Kuala Lumpur to Rawang.

The station is divided into different sections for various rail services, with the ETS located on Level Two of the Transit Concourse, where passengers can purchase ETS tickets at the ETS Ticket Counter and wait for their train in the waiting area.

In addition to the ETS, KL Sentral serves as an interchange station for KTM Komuter’s Port Klang Line and Seremban Line. KTM Komuter is located at Level One of the station. Tickets can be purchased at the ticket counters and ticketing machines located on both sides of Level 1 of KL Sentral’s main concourse, while the KTM Komuter trains are located on Level 1 of KL Sentral’s Transit Concourse.

Moreover, visitors and workers in the KL Sentral area can take advantage of the parking lot, retail and food outlets, and food court available at the station.

Kuala Lumpur Station

The Kuala Lumpur Station, situated on Jalan Sultan Hishamuddin Street, provides a second departure point for those traveling to Rawang. It is only 400 meters away from Pasar Seni MRT station and Pasar Seni LRT station, which can be reached through the pedestrian walkway over the Klang River.

This station is renowned for its colonial-style architecture dating back to the early 1900s and mainly serves KTM Intercity trains, which are a more affordable option compared to the ETS trains.

Apart from basic facilities like food outlets, a parking lot, and a convenience store, the station also has ticket counters and waiting areas for passengers.

Arrival Point: Rawang Station

Rawang Station is a busy railway station located in Rawang, Selangor, Malaysia that serves as a stop for both KTM Komuter and KTM ETS train services and is located within a 10-minute walk from the bus terminal. It has one side platform and one island platform, with a total of six tracks.

The station offers various facilities and services to its passengers, including a surau for prayer, a kiosk for snacks and drinks, a Touch ‘n Go lane, ticket counters, toilets, parking, ticket vending machines, lifts, and an ATM. The station operates from 6:15 to 21:30 daily, providing convenient access to commuters and travelers.

Alternatives

There is currently no direct MRT or LRT line that connects to Rawang. The nearest stations are Sungai Buloh for the MRT (located about 18 km from Rawang) and Gombak for the LRT (located approximately 26 km from the city). While these options may require additional transportation to reach Rawang, they can be a viable alternative to avoid the crowds and congestion at the Rawang railway station.

About ETS

Known for being the fastest meter gauge train service in the country, the ETS operates along the electrified and double-tracked stretch of the West Coast Line between Gemas and Padang Besar on the Malaysia-Thai border. ETS offers three classes of service – Platinum, Gold, and Silver – with Platinum being the quickest and most direct, and Silver being the most affordable option. Ticket prices vary based on class, time of day, and distance traveled, with discounts available for seniors, students, and the disabled.

ETS trains provide spacious seats, power outlets, and air conditioning, as well as a variety of facilities to ensure passengers have a comfortable and enjoyable journey. These facilities include a musolla for prayer, an F&B Bistro for food and beverages, luggage racks, special seats for elderly and disabled passengers, and LCD screens to keep passengers informed.

About KTM Komuter

KTM Komuter is a commuter rail service that operates in Malaysia, providing local rail services in Kuala Lumpur and the surrounding suburban areas in the Klang Valley. Established in 1995, KTM Komuter expanded its services in September 2015 to include the northern states of Perak, Pulau Pinang, Kedah, and Perlis. The service provides several facilities to ensure a safe, comfortable, and convenient journey for passengers, including a designated Ladies’ Coach, priority seating for the elderly and disabled, and 24/7 CCTV surveillance. Additionally, KTM Komuter offers a unique facility for cyclists with trains that can carry bicycles.
